name: Grand Pineapple Beach Antigua

reviews.title: A Truly Terrible Hotel
reviews.text: I am well qualified to comment on this hotel because I've stayed there three times in the past 10 years. In 1994 I was married there and in 1997 I returned for our 3rd wedding anniversary. In those days the hotel was owned by Rob Barrat and it was quite simply a wonderful place to stay. Fabulous beach location, well run and well maintained hotel with a classy atmosphere. Since this time the hotel has undergone numerous changes of ownership. I returned there in November 2003 to discover that this once wonderful hotel has transformed itself into a cheap and tacky "Holiday Camp" style vacation property. The rooms are damp and shabby. The restaurant food is awful and many of the buildings are falling apart from a lack of maintenance and repair. All day and all night guests are subjected to the constant boom boom of the PA system and loud, loud music. The staff have abandoned all hope and are so dejected that they have no interest in guest welfare. This is no place for a relaxing holiday. After a week of this nonsense we moved to St. James's Club, a hotel the exudes all of the qualities that Pineapple used to have. Do not believe any of the so-called positive reviews of this hotel. It used to be fabulous, now it's quite simply awful. Pay a bit more and stay at St. James's (many of the former Pineapple staff work there, what a surprise!).

reviews.title: Good value
reviews.text: Well, we are back and not a bit happy about it!! I will try to keep this somewhat organized, but apologize up front if it turns out not to be.

reviews.title: Fantastic beach for those who like quiet places
I would go back there tomorrow!!!
reviews.text: The resort:

reviews.title: Fantastic
reviews.text: We had previously stayed at the Allegro resort in Turks&Caicos (this resort had not been bought by Occidental and has since been torn down). We found the Antigua resort to be similar to that one in the set-up, food, etc. We both thought this resort showed signs of proper care - fresh paint, etc. Our room was fantastic (832) - the view was the best!! The hike up the hill to our room was never an issue (ok...maybe after a few drinks it was a little more taxing ...but...that was our fault!!) The common areas were fine - my only complaint was with the guests leaving glasses, etc all over the place. I will never understand why people cannot walk to a trash can 10 feet away but thats my personal pet peeve. The entertainment was fine...we enjoyed the 3 or 4 of the nightly shows. The night with the group (I cannot remember their name - had a male singer and two females) was great entertainment - best live band we had seen in a while (by that I mean bands that you would see in a night club). All of the staff we encountered were very friendly. The only staff that didn't seem quite so outgoing was the bar staff but that could have been because we never 'sat' at the bar and made conversation with them - so no blame on them! Ms. Mary (the Outhouse) are keepers!! What a great place and one you would not normally come across at an all-inclusive so a very nice change! We left the New Hampshire license plate swaying in the breeze! Overall, the food was fine. Our only complaint was that it would have been great to have snacks like popcorn, pretzels, etc available. Breakfast is always my favorite while on vacation because I never seem to have time when at home so I loved that! We never got into the Pineapple Grill but did enjoy Chef Pietros one night. The vendors on the beach were never a problem. At checkout we did experience a charge to our room for the internet that neither of us did. It was a charge for the morning we were leaving - was only $5 and they did remove it when they confirmed the signature was not ours. Our transfers from the airport were fine with no issues.

reviews.title: Excellent holiday
reviews.text: We have just returned from a second visit to the GPB and have had a wonderful holiday. some of the reviews on here are a little negative and to be honest i think if you want to find fault you can, and if you expect 5* luxury then you need to pay the price and go elsewhere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: This resort is charming, the staff are friendly and welcoming, the beach is stunning the sea is warm and the rooms are clean. I guess the food can be a little repeative but we never found ourselves in a situation where there wasn't something we liked to eat.
reviews.title: Amazing holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010
reviews.text: The entertainment is a bit low key but that suited us fine, if we had wanted a loud and lively holiday we would have looked elsewhere. There are some lovely people working at this resort, Jules keeps everyone entertained, the volley ball was always fun to watch, even if my husband did manage to break his little fingers whilst playing. Goldine in the Topez restaurant is a wonderful hostess, Joanne and winsome serve up breakfast and lunch with a kind work and a big smile. Franklin, stephen and jason work hard behind the bar to keep everything running smoothly and Barbara the guest services manager is professional, friendly and efficient. And if thats not enough they also now have a resident donkey (normally she lives by the gym or the tennis courts) take Pineapple Penny an apple or carrot and she'll be your friend forever.
reviews.title: The Honest Truth about the Grand Pineapple

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The real star in the pineapples crown is marys outhouse (I can't believe someone on here posted that it should be tidied up), this shack is ramshackle, filled with bits and pieces that people have written on, the view is wonderful the welcome is outstanding and the ribs and chicked help you forget the walk up the hill. Marys welcome makes it the best place to have lunch, and if you are lucky you will see a mongoose and play and get a vist from one of the ever hungry cats.
reviews.title: I had a great time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you look hard you will find things to moan about, yes there are flies and birds but hey its the caribbean so they are to be expected. Things move slowiy but thats one of the best reasons to go, suddenly you find yourself slowing down and thats what vacations are for.
reviews.title: Fantastic! Wedding out of this world.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Like many of the reviewers of this hotel I rarely submit reviews. However, having read some of the reviews I felt compelled to add my thoughts to the debate about this hotel.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for and this was good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In my view the comments seem to fall into three categories – some are simple wrong either through misunderstanding or lack of knowledge; some can be accounted for as simple a matter of taste, judgement or expectations and as always there are some with an element of truth.
reviews.title: Trust me, Big rip off

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Let’s deal first with those that are simply wrong.
reviews.title: Dream wedding, loved it loved it loved it - thank you GPB Antigua

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were lucky enough to stay in to stay in two of the 500 block rooms, the waterfront rooms. These have been recently refurbished and are to good standard. They are clean, air conditioned, reasonably well appointed and the refurbishment work has been carried out to a good standard. The real plus point with these rooms is the great view of the bay. Admittedly there are some rooms in other parts of the hotel grounds which from what we could see are still to be refurbished. However to state as one recent reviewer has that only seven rooms had been refurbished is completely false! From a simple walk around the resort it is clear that a number of the blocks have been refurbished. It is obvious from ongoing work that all of the rooms will eventually be refurbished. However, until they are it is worthwhile trying to book one of the refurbished rooms in advance when you book the holiday.
reviews.title: You either get it or you don't

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As with all hotels, the staff are a mixture of types – some competent and hard working others less so. Similarly the apparent friendliness of staff varies. I say apparent friendliness because I never fail to be surprised at the bad manners of some guests. By and large I have found that you are normally treated by others as you would treat them. Just because you are paying doesn’t give you the right to be rude to staff. Generally we found the staff to be helpful, friendly and hard working although it is true that one or two could benefit from training.
reviews.title: Not just a great beach.
don't listen to the negative people
reviews.text: if you did not appreciate the beauty and service of this resort then i am glad i didn't have the opportunity of meeting you. first off, the islands will never provide you things in new york time. if you want this go somewhere else. you are on a remote island and things will invariably happen every time. the pineapple provided us with everything we wanted and looked forward to. KADISHA made us feel as though we were the only couple getting married the whole week. thank you and great job! the water was breathtaking and the beach magnificent. you will not be let down. if you want to go somewhere that provides peace and serenity, good food and great service don't hesitate to book this trip. thanks pineapple!

reviews.title: Wonderful vacation
reviews.text: After reading the reviews on this site, we were very concerned about our week-long vacation. From the reviews, I expected poor food, poor service and NO evening entertainment, etc. Well, I can tell you that the reviews were wrong.

reviews.title: Fantastic Holiday - Good Place to Stay!!
reviews.text: The food was fine- much better than I expected given that they are trying to serve a large number of people with a variety of palates- plenty of selections even for the picky eater that I am. There were two buffet nights, the rest was a la carte. Lunch is a la carte, breakfast is buffet. The service was fine- slow, but they operate on island time just like everyone else in the caribbean does. The only exception is the snack bar. Oh man!! they can't multi-task at all, plus they really were not friendly, but it was a good place to grab something quicker than the restaurant. The bar and general waitstaff were friendly if you showed them that you acknowledged them as individuals (ie Hi Vera) and the bar staff remembered what my usual order was and would frequently have it ready for me when I walked up to the bar--Pretty impressive I would say.

reviews.title: A balanced critique
reviews.text: Our room was stunning- we got the ocean view rooms on the hill and the view and nice breezes we got made up for any inconvenience in climbing the hill when the bartenders remembered our drink order one too many times (yep- all their fault!).

reviews.title: My Best Holiday Ever!
reviews.text: The entertainment was fine- this is a small resort that is not a Sandals or Beaches- if you want big, flashy shows or dancing all night long, this may not be the place for you. The first night they had a steel pan band, next night was bingo and a dj for dancing, next night Karaoke and dj, etc... Plus, we won a snorkle trip playing bingo- what a great bonus, I would say!! They had daytime activites as well, the staff tried to get people involved, but were not pushy about it. All I can say is that if people got bored, it is really their own fault. They supply all sorts of board games (backgammon, pictionary, cards etc...) and you can check them out and keep them all week if you want.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: stayed at GPBC for 7 days over new year, with my wife and two friends - both couples aged in early fifties - rooms o k , had ocean view room but kept awake all night by wind whistling through shutters and ill fitting doors. Food very hit and miss , sometimes inedible - staff generally friendly but not very efficien t recepcion staff had a sort of bossy take it or leave it attitude. beach was good but sea rough as its on the atlantic side not on carribean other side of the island . new years eve gala dinner was an absolute disaster - to many people - not enough food - we all agreed it was our worst ever. Antigua is a nice island and would visit again but will stay on the west coast in better class hotel. It all depends on how fussey you are but we would definately not reccomend GPBC -- its TIRED and not good value for money.
reviews.title: give it a miss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel in Feb 2007. It was our first visit to the Caribbean and we loved it! I would not describe the hotel as 4 star but it was clean and comfortable and the food was reasonable. It needs a bit of TLC as and they were doing some painting while we were there. I would not describe the staff as particularly friendly,especially the bar staff.
reviews.title: Had a great holiday

likes.disliked: — It was a bit tired,the bathroom was not v inviting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We hired a car which was great,we would have gone mad sat on the same beach for a week. The roads were terrible but it was an experience driving round them! We found some beautiful secluded beaches and English Harbour was lovely.
reviews.title: Enjoyed Antigua, hated this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would go back to this hotel again but would really prefer to stay somewhere a bit more luxurious next time
reviews.title: Great Holiday at the Grand Pineapple

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in February. We'd had to book a holiday at the last minute after having to cancel our original plans due to family illness. Unfortunately, it soon beame apparent why this was one of the few holidays available. The hotel's decor had obviously not been touch for many a year. The rooms are very basic and shabby. The bed gave me a bad back. It was very hit or miss if you got clean towels. The shower gel ran out after 3 days and we were told that they didn't have anymore. Aren't they paying their bills? We had to buy some in their shop for $10!! The food was absolutely shocking and inedible. The cheapest ingredients (meat full of gristle) were used. Despite being all inclusive we found ourselves eating out every day. Good food was very easy to find in Antigua and we found the people very friendly. The best part of the hotel was the beach, without a doubt. The setting and grounds could be used for a top class hotel, but this certainly isn't it.
reviews.title: Not what we expected!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a weeks holiday to the Grand Pineapple Hotel in Antigua. Unfortunately with memories of this hotel it is unlikely that we will return to Antigua. Reviews on Tripadvisor had mentioned the poor service in the hotel restaurant and rather "tired rooms", but that did not seem a huge deterrent. However, these issues were the tip of the iceberg. I would warn any potential traveller to be wary. We inadvertently left our camera (relatively expensive in a large camera case) in the bar - completely our own fault. One of the bar staff kindly handed it into reception and it was logged into the lost and found book. When we realised we had left the camera in the bar we went to reception and asked the receptionist Barbara if it had been handed in. Barbara gave her stock answer to all questions and requests - an abrupt "no", She didnt check the lost and found or ask anyone else. We went back on three further occassions to enquire with the same result. The member of staff who had been off duty since handing the camera in, returned two days later and told us what she had done. She apologised for not taking the camera home to look after as she would normally - leaving us with the clear impression that theft is not an unusual occurance from reception.
reviews.title: Not what it could be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We returned to reception and eventually got to speak to the reception manager who was less than helpful. It was only when we said we wanted the police involved that any action was taken and the security manager was called. After taking a statement he said he would investigate, however when pressed he said he had a good idea what had happened! To cut a long story short - we never got the camera back, we did eventually get the paperwork we needed for our insurance company.
reviews.title: Thoroughly Enjoyable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007
reviews.text: If this incident had just involved one dishonest member of staff one could chalk it up to experience. However the attitude of the staff and management with regard to this and to general service issues really is very poor. Whilst not expecting 5 star treatment, pleasant helpful staff shouldnt be too much to ask for.
reviews.title: excellent stay
Good place, good experience overall
reviews.text: Okay - so here is the definitive review of the Grand Pineapple Beach Resort - all others can be ignored. It’s a little long-winded but I wanted to get all of my impressions in. We were there for 2 weeks starting Feb. 12th.

reviews.title: Overall a great vacation, with some negatives
reviews.text: First, the perspective customer needs to realize there is a difference between a 5 star rating in the Caribbean compared to say, Monaco – they just aren’t the same.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for a week in the ocean front rooms, (500+). Being honest after arriving and being "disappointed", small hot reception, having a 400 dollar deposit taken on credit card, we were "wow" with the room. Small ish balcony, but view beach to the right and sea in front of us. Our bed and pillows were so comfortable, often fell asleep for hours when having a nap to escape rain.
reviews.title: Not wow when you arrive - but soon fall in love with true carribean feeling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very unlucky with the weather but still managed to get a tan, and my partner was quite badly burnt in the cloud.
reviews.title: Lovely staff but hotel outdated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010
reviews.text: Bar staff very friendly and try to make cocktails to suit :-), the coke often tasted watery or flat. Chairs not comfortable but evening entertainment bands that were mainly good for background noise.
reviews.title: Not wonderful, but you learn to love it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booking restaurants, a day in advance from 10am, by 10.10 you could only eat at 9. Resort was only half full and found this annoying.
reviews.title: Antigua vacation at Grand Pineapple

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast and lunch good, (omelettes etc being made fresh in morning), some lunch times lovely pittas and rolls being made. Food was average for all inclusive, some a la carte dinners were good. PLEASE NOTE men expected to wear trousers, collared shirt or t shirt and shoes. Felt restaurants were not "posh" enough for this. Main restaurants are on/overlooking beach, lovely view. Birds do hop in during day so make sure you put a plate over any drinks or food whilst wandering around. Staff very good at getting water and drinks from bar during meal times.
reviews.title: Grand Pineapple Beach honest review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not know what to expect from our holiday after reading so many different views so went with am open mind. After all this is not Weymouth, its in Antigua.
reviews.title: Great location + Great people = Great holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for 1 week, all inclusive. I would agree that this hotel is slightly older and tired, but many of the rooms are being updated at present to what looked like a high standard.
reviews.title: great beach holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in room 125, right next to the sea and directly on the beach. WOW! Room was fine, bathroom needed an update, but everything worked and was cleaned every day. Bed was not the most comfortable, but okay. Location was fantastic. Views amazing.
reviews.title: Fantastic setting and friendly staff - felt like paradise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was okay for most meals but staying longer than a week might be a bit repetative. the booking system is very poor, but could be sorted out with a little thought by the hotel. Even the days you forget to book, its easy enough to blag a table. Breakfast was normally good, with a good choice, lunch was avarage and evening meals ranged from average to good. But this is to be expected for the price.
reviews.title: Absolutely the BEST, Steps to the waters edge..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel staff were all very nice and friendly. this may in part be due to the ammount of time representatvies from Sandles were on the site. Sandles have deffinately improved things and the hotel is begining to run like a proper hotel.
reviews.title: Let's get real -- this place is worth every penny
Great resort for the days, not so great for the evenings!
reviews.text: Just returned from 2 weeks holiday at the Grand Pineapple with two teenage daughters. This was only our second all inclusive and first caribbean trip so we have little to compare with, but we are seasoned travellers!

reviews.title: beautiful beach
reviews.text: Positive points:

reviews.title: Depends on what you're looking for
reviews.text: Great beach - we hired a car and visited other beaches on the 'caribbean' side and can honestly say this was the best (for turquoise sea AND whitest sand)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2004
reviews.text: Watersports - brilliant. No problem with access and the winds were great! The staff will take out non-sailors for a trip on the catamaran which was a nice touch.
reviews.title: This beach is worth it!
Not Really Grand...But Relaxing
reviews.text: Food - plenty for all of us and we thought quality was good. Liked the opportunity for a leisurely lunch in the main resturant. Tried all the resturants (air conditioning was nice in the pineapple grill!)

reviews.title: A very good vacation resort
reviews.text: We stayed at PB from Oct 17 thru Oct 24. We celebrated our 33rd anniversary on the 23rd. Prior to our arrival I emailed a request for an arrangement of flowers to be waiting in our room for my wife. Upon our entering the room they where the 1st thing my wife saw. extra points for that! We where in room 125, right on the beach. The room was basic, but the location was great. Our only problem was tracking in beach sand.

reviews.title: A nice relaxing resort with all you need
reviews.text: The main dining room is Tapaz. Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner, no complaints. Emily, your very helpful.

reviews.title: Fab holiday!!
reviews.text: The bar opens early and closes around 11PM. Entertainment nightly, No complaints there.

reviews.title: It's OK but not 4 star
reviews.text: We ate twice at the Pineapple Grill. the 2nd night was our anniversary. Champagne was served and both meals were good. Try the garlic seafood pasta.

reviews.title: Never again!!!
reviews.text: The 3rd dining room is an extension of Topaz. We didn't try it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our family just recently visited the Occidental Grand Pinapple Beach Resort in Antigua. We booked 5 rooms and were all situated in the top row of units overlooking the swimming area.
reviews.title: Decent resort but has staff issues

likes.liked: — Beach, view, rooms, Mary (rib shack), breakfast servers, housekeeping, night security

reviews.title: The best holiday ever!!!
reviews.text: The resort is very laid back and relaxing and we were all fairly satisfied with the amenities. The rooms we had were all very large and well appointed. Beds are moderately comfortable but are a touch on the firm side. Housecleaning at the resort is outstanding and we were never disturbed during our stay. The housecleaning staff is the friendliest I've encountered and always smiled and greeted me in the morning.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The security staff is also top notch and watch the rooms during the night which leads to a very secure feeling at the resort. I might also add that I noticed the security staff at the gate checked the trunks of all employees cars which were leaving the parking area. This leads me to believe that they take guest security very seriously.
reviews.title: Honeymoon at Grand Pineapple Beach

likes.liked: — Food and drinks available almost any hour of the day or night!
likes.disliked: — everything cost more to leave the resort

reviews.title: nice resort but...
reviews.text: The main buffet restaurant was of average quality with respect to dinner; however, the breakfast was always quite good with the exception of their sausages which should be avoided at all costs. A special touch is the warm and friendly demeanour of the lady who cooks the omelets in the morning. She is a treasure and always started us off right in the morning. The morning staff I noticed were always more cheerful than the evening staff. Although the buffet dinners were nothing special, I highly recommend the a la carte restaurant at the top of the hill next to the disco. We received much better service there and they serve one of the most delicious ribeyes I've ever had. Be warned that I was turned back one evening for wearing pleated golf shorts, so don't forget to wear pants if you are dining at this restaurant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent most of our trip relaxing by the pool and enjoying the gorgeous sand and ocean scenes. The quality of the beach is outstanding and surely the highlight of the resort. We also enjoyed the beach volleyball and played nearly ever day. One problem however, is that the activity staff can be a little anoying once in a while and tend to forget that guests come before their own enjoyment.
reviews.title: Fantastic Beach Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Well, after seeing some negative reviews of this resort, we went to the Grand Pineapple with some reservations (2 adults, a 6 year old and an 20 month old) but can honestly say it was a fantastic holiday! If you are expecting 5* "american style" accommodation and service then you will be disappointed but if you go with the flow (and the cocktails!) you will have a great time!
reviews.title: Fantastic Holiday !

likes.liked: — Clean rooms and fresh towels every day

reviews.title: For an all-inclusive hotel, it is better than most
reviews.text: Lots of the staff got to know us and our kids and were very helpful. Agree about the Topaz restaurant not being very speedy - our kids meals sometimes arrived at different times than the adults meals - but hey, just chill out ! It is a spectacular setting and the beach is great. Also, we unexpectedly had some kids entertainment going on (Jules and Duane!) who dug sandcastles, played games and generally were great with the kids. We didn't sample any of the evening entertainment as we were too tired after full day with kids, but would highly recommend the Bird Island Picnic Cruise, also Harmony Hall for a posh lunch and trip to Green Island. And the locals were so friendly - eg my 6 year old wanted a steel pan (drum!) but we couldn't find one, so one of the taxi drivers brought one for him the next time she came to the resort and it was a gift. So just go with the flow and you will have a GREAT time !

reviews.title: Lovely beach
reviews.text: This resort has an intimate feel too it because it is only two stories high. The landscaping is nicely done as well as the evening lighting. Some buildings are built into the hillside and others are directly on the beach or oceanfront on a small cliff. Some other reviewers mentioned poor water pressure. We had an oceanfront room and others we met had garden view rooms or rooms on the hill and they had no problems with water pressure. It seems to be a problem for some of the beachfront rooms only.

reviews.title: Great beach & tropical gardens
reviews.text: The property was recently sold to Beaches. I've never stayed at a Beaches property so I'm not sure if that's good or bad. Apparently, the change won't take place for another six weeks. Some employees who were offered only contract work from the new owner may be upset with the change but everyone we came in contact with was very pleasant and helpful. The bar help were the least friendly but it seemed to me that they were very overworked and had less time to socialize with guests.

reviews.title: Got married here
reviews.text: I've been to many all-inclusive resorts and this one was better for the following reasons: The drinks were not watered down. The food was above average. If you made a dinner reservation, you could order from a menu and be served at your table rather than a buffet. And lastly, the day entertainment at the pool was NOT obnoxiouly LOUD.

aka: Grand Pineapple Beach Antigua Hotel St. John`s
description: •Situated on Long Bay – the best secluded white sand beach on the north-eastern coast in Antigua•Thirty minutes away from the V.C. Bird International Airport and from St. John’s, Antigua’s capital city•An all-inclusive resort that caters to everyone…singles, couples, families and groups•Houses 180 deluxe rooms with bright and colorful buildings and perfectly manicured gardens •Interactive and family oriented…where warm and friendly staff refers to guests by name
